result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Horak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges - Joint & Severally w/ co-defts.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State, by phone. Defendant appeared in custody, by phone. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court reporter by phone. Due to the Statewide Emergency declared by the Governor regarding the COVID-19, this hearing is being held via telephone conferencing. Deft's request concerning restitution. ADA McNeill states she believes the it is an institution issue rather than the court's order. Court takes no action.
With Jennifer/Oshkosh Correctional Institution a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the TC on 3/30/20 at 8:15am.
Telephone conference on March 30, 2020 at 08:15 am.

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statements from:  Lisa W., Brooke E., Steven H. and Ron Z.  Court imposes a total sentence of 15 years WSP; 10 years initial confinement w/credit for 515 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/condiitons; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft will stipulate to restitution as determined joint & several in co-deft's cases which are scheduled for a restitution hearing on 9/25/15 before Commissioner Dowse.
